instruction: What kinds of spectrum (NIR) were used to identify the variety and geographical origin of the apples?
Output: The past study used near-infrared (NIR) spectra to identify the variety and geographical origin of the apples.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to conduct variable selection in identify the variety and geographical origin of the apples?
Output: PCA and SPA were used to conduct variable selection in identifying the variety and geographical origin of the apples.

instruction: What metric (identification accuracy) was chosen to evaluate the performance of the models to identify the variety and geographical origin of the apples, and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the modelswas identification accuracy. The past study reported that the SPA-ELM model achieved an identification accuracy of 98.33% on the calibration set and 96.67% on the prediction set. Therefore, the identification accuracy metric reached a maximum accuracy of 98.33% in terms of distinguishing apple variety and geographical origin using NIR spectroscopy.

instruction: What machine learning models were used that aimed to investigate the feasibility of using near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy to identify apple variety and cultivation region?
Output: The machine learning models used were backpropagation neural network (BPNN), support vector machine (SVM), and extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the experimental results of the past study, which showed that the ELM models outperformed the BPNN and SVM models in identifying apple variety and geographical origin using NIR spectroscopy, be considered as evidence that spectroscopic methods are superior to traditional methods in this context?
Output:
The experimental results of this study suggest that the ELM models performed better than the BPNN and SVM models in identifying apple variety and geographical origin using NIR spectroscopy. However, this does not necessarily imply that spectroscopic methods are superior to traditional methods in this context. 

The past study only compared the performance of different pattern recognition methods using NIR spectroscopy, and it does not provide any direct comparison or evaluation of traditional methods. Therefore, it is not possible to conclude that spectroscopic methods are superior to traditional methods based solely on the results of this study.
